Ironic that you bring this up. If Bitcoin's consensus mechanism is PoW (as defined in the Bitecoim White Paper) and hashrate chose Bitcoin over all other invalid forks including Bitcoin Cash, this means that Bitcoin Cash is NOT Bitcoin. You can't have the cake and eat it too!

The problem here is this: With on-chain Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum etc. if you sign and broadcast a transaction to the network (assuming you have internet access), it's going to make it into a block and confirm. It may be slow or cost a bunch in fees, but it'll go through.
